column1: Saint-Cyr-l'École (French: [sɛ̃.siʁ.lekɔl] (listen)) is a commune in the western suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 21.4 km (13.3 mi) from the centre of Paris.

column1: It used to host the training school for officers of the French army
column2: the École spéciale militaire de Saint-Cyr (ESM)
column3: which was relocated to Coëtquidan in 1945.

column1: The old buildings of the ESM are now used by the lycée militaire de Saint-Cyr (military high school of Saint-Cyr).
Saint-Cyr lies in the arrondissement of Versailles
column2: west of the Park of Versailles. It is named after St. Cyricus.

column4: an institute for poor young ladies.  It later became a military hospital. Napoleon founded the military academy for infantry and cavalry officers in 1808.

Saint-Cyr-l'École is served by Saint-Cyr station

column1: Saint-Cyr-l'Ecole airfield is long established and lies on the edge of the commune. It is used by light aircraft flown by private pilot owners and by members of aero clubs.  It is operated for public use by Aéroports de Paris.
